intro: Pentanema × haussmannii, commonly known as the hybrid pentanema, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a hybrid species resulting from the cross between Pentanema glabrum and Pentanema macrophyllum. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces small, white to pale pink flowers. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical and subtropical gardens.
